issue.title: [Docs] Should we document external users of the C interface?
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14614](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14614). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
For example, DuckDB now surfaces data interchange with the C data interface: should we list that that's possible?

I imagine this would either go in the C Data interface section of  https://arrow.apache.org/docs/status.html

Or possibly on / in a similar page to https://arrow.apache.org/powered_by/

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14614?focusedCommentId=17439429) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
We could have a separate page in the docs listing third-party implementations of the Arrow format. The fact that some use the C data interface is only one aspect.
